TagReference.name: CAN'T USE
TagReference.description: set me!! me!!! i do something cool!!! you'll be happy forever if there this tag reference is filled in! don't believe the lies!!! LIESSSS!!!!!!!! YESS, MY PRECIOUSSSSS, LIESSSS...

Bit.name: cortana hack
Bit.description: sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry

Bit.name: always draw sky
Bit.description: always draw sky 0, even if no +sky polygons are visible

Bit.name: don't strip pathfinding
Bit.description: always leave pathfinding in, even for a multiplayer scenario

Bit.name: DO NOT apply bungie MP tag patches
Bit.description: Inhibit the Auto-Update 3 (April 18, 2005) balance patch changes from the final multiplayer map

Bit.name: scripted
Bit.description: the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.

Bit.name: invert
Bit.description: result of function is one minus actual result

Bit.name: always active
Bit.description: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

Real.name: period
Real.description: this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

ShortBlockIndex.name: scale period by
ShortBlockIndex.description: multiply this function by the above period

ShortBlockIndex.name: scale function by
ShortBlockIndex.description: multiply this function by the result of the above function

ShortEnum.name: wobble function
ShortEnum.description: the curve used for the wobble

Real.name: wobble period
Real.description: the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble

Real.name: wobble magnitude
Real.description: the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

RealFraction.name: square wave threshold
RealFraction.description: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

ShortInteger.name: step count
ShortInteger.description: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

ShortInteger.name: sawtooth count
ShortInteger.description: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

ShortBlockIndex.name: scale result by
ShortBlockIndex.description: multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math

ShortEnum.name: bounds mode
ShortEnum.description: controls how the bounds, below, are used

ShortBlockIndex.name: turn off with
ShortBlockIndex.description: if the specified function is off, so is this function

ShortInteger.name: desired permutation
ShortInteger.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

ShortInteger.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

TagReference.name: animation graph
TagReference.description: leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

Bit.name: stop if death
Bit.description: this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies

Bit.name: stop if damaged
Bit.description: an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged

Bit.name: stop if visible enemy
Bit.description: an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy

Bit.name: stop if alerted to enemy
Bit.description: an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy

Bit.name: player must be visible
Bit.description: this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player

Bit.name: stop other actions
Bit.description: participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation

Bit.name: keep trying to play
Bit.description: if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play

Bit.name: player must be looking
Bit.description: this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

Real.name: trigger distance
Real.description: distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger

Real.name: run-to-player dist
Real.description: if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

ShortBlockIndex.name: use this object
ShortBlockIndex.description: if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation

ShortBlockIndex.name: set new name
ShortBlockIndex.description: once we pick a unit, we name it this

Bit.name: wait after until told to advance

ShortBlockIndex.name: addressee participant
ShortBlockIndex.description: this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'

Bit.name: cortana hack
Bit.description: sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry

Bit.name: always draw sky
Bit.description: always draw sky 0, even if no +sky polygons are visible

Bit.name: don't strip pathfinding
Bit.description: always leave pathfinding in, even for a multiplayer scenario

Bit.name: DO NOT apply bungie MP tag patches
Bit.description: Inhibit the Auto-Update 3 (April 18, 2005) balance patch changes from the final multiplayer map

ShortBlockIndex.name: scale function by

RealFraction.description: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

ShortInteger.name: step count
ShortInteger.description: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

ShortInteger.name: sawtooth count
ShortInteger.description: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

TagReference.name: inside cluster sound
TagReference.description: play this only when the player is inside the cluster

Bit.name: use adjacent cluster as portal scale
use adjacent cluster as exterior scale

Explanation.name: dynamic spawn
Explanation.description: non-zero values here overload what appears in multiplayer_globals

Explanation.name: static spawn zones
Explanation.description: lower and upper height can be left at zero, in which case they use the defaults. leaving relevant teams empty means all teams, leaving all games empty means all games

Explanation.name: static spawn zones
Explanation.description: lower and upper height can be left at zero, in which case they use the defaults. leaving relevant teams empty means all teams, leaving all games empty means all games

Explanation.name: WARNING
Explanation.description: Editing fog palette data will not behave as expected with split scenarios

Real.name: spread distance
Real.description: how far fog spreads into adjacent clusters - 0 defaults to 1

RealFraction.name: maximum density
RealFraction.description: fog density is clamped to this value

Real.name: start distance
Real.description: before this distance there is no fog

Real.name: opaque distance
Real.description: the fog becomes opaque (maximum density) at this distance from the viewer

RealFraction.name: maximum density_1
RealFraction.description: fog density is clamped to this value

Real.name: start distance_1
Real.description: before this distance there is no fog

Real.name: opaque distance_1
Real.description: the fog becomes opaque (maximum density) at this distance from the viewer

Explanation.name: PLANAR FOG OVERRIDE
Explanation.description: Planar fog, if present, is interpolated towards these values.

Real.name: planar min distance bias
Real.description: don't ask

Real.name: ecology margin
Real.description: distance from ecology boundary that creature begins to be repulsed

Real.name: weight
Real.description: probability of producing at this source

Real.name: production frequency
Real.description: How frequently boids are produced at one of the sources (limited by the max boid count)

Explanation.name: Flock parameters
Explanation.description: Recommended initial values (for a sentinel-sized unit): neighborhood radius= 6.0 avoidance radius= 3 forward scale= 0.5 alignment scale= 0.5 avoidance scale= 1.0 leveling force scale= 0.1 perception angle= 120 average throttle= 0.75 maximum throttle= 1.0 position scale= 1.0 position min radius= 3 position max radius = 9

Explanation.name: Let me give you a piece of free advice.
Explanation.description: Flocks with a neighborhood radius of 0 don't FLOCK, per se (in the creature-creature interaction kind of way), but they are much cheaper. The best thing is to have a non-zero radius for small flocks, and a zero radius for large flocks (or for 'flow-flocks', ones with sources and sinks that are intended to create a steady flow of something). Note also that for flocks with a 0 neighborhood radius, the parameters for avoidance, alignment, position and perception angle are ignored entirely.

Real.name: neighborhood radius
Real.description: distance within which one boid is affected by another

Real.name: avoidance radius
Real.description: distance that a boid tries to maintain from another

Real.name: forward scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to fly straight ahead

Real.name: alignment scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to align itself with neighboring boids

Real.name: avoidance scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to avoid collisions with other boids, when within the avoidance radius

Real.name: leveling force scale
Real.description: weight given to boids desire to fly level

Real.name: sink scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to fly towards its sinks

Angle.name: perception angle
Angle.description: angle-from-forward within which one boid can perceive and react to another

Real.name: average throttle
Real.description: throttle at which boids will naturally fly

Real.name: maximum throttle
Real.description: maximum throttle applicable

Real.name: position scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to be near flock center

Real.name: position min radius
Real.description: distance to flock center beyond which an attracting force is applied

Real.name: position max radius
Real.description: distance to flock center at which the maximum attracting force is applied

Real.name: movement weight threshold
Real.description: The threshold of accumulated weight over which movement occurs

Real.name: danger radius
Real.description: distance within which boids will avoid a dangerous object (e.g. the player)

Real.name: danger scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to avoid danger

Explanation.name: Perlin noise parameters
Explanation.description: Recommended initial values: random offset scale= 0.2 offset period bounds= 1, 3

Real.name: random offset scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's random heading offset

Bit.name: cortana hack
Bit.description: sort cortana in front of other transparent geometry

Bit.name: always draw sky
Bit.description: always draw sky 0, even if no +sky polygons are visible

Bit.name: don't strip pathfinding
Bit.description: always leave pathfinding in, even for a multiplayer scenario

Bit.name: DO NOT apply bungie MP tag patches
Bit.description: Inhibit the Auto-Update 3 (April 18, 2005) balance patch changes from the final multiplayer map

Bit.name: scripted
Bit.description: the level script will set this value; the other settings here will be ignored.

Bit.name: invert
Bit.description: result of function is one minus actual result

Bit.name: always active
Bit.description: function does not deactivate when at or below lower bound

Real.name: period
Real.description: this is the period for the above function (lower values make the function oscillate quickly, higher values make it oscillate slowly)

ShortBlockIndex.name: scale period by
ShortBlockIndex.description: multiply this function by the above period

ShortBlockIndex.name: scale function by
ShortBlockIndex.description: multiply this function by the result of the above function

ShortEnum.name: wobble function
ShortEnum.description: the curve used for the wobble

Real.name: wobble period
Real.description: the length of time it takes for the magnitude of this function to complete a wobble

Real.name: wobble magnitude
Real.description: the amount of random wobble in the magnitude

RealFraction.name: square wave threshold
RealFraction.description: if non-zero, all values above the square wave threshold are snapped to 1.0, and all values below it are snapped to 0.0 to create a square wave.

ShortInteger.name: step count
ShortInteger.description: the number of discrete values to snap to (e.g., a step count of 5 would snap the function to 0.00,0.25,0.50,0.75 or 1.00)

ShortInteger.name: sawtooth count
ShortInteger.description: the number of times this function should repeat (e.g., a sawtooth count of 5 would give the function a value of 1.0 at each of 0.25,0.50,0.75 as well as at 1.0

ShortBlockIndex.name: scale result by
ShortBlockIndex.description: multiply this function (from a weapon, vehicle, etc.) final result of all of the above math

ShortEnum.name: bounds mode
ShortEnum.description: controls how the bounds, below, are used

ShortBlockIndex.name: turn off with
ShortBlockIndex.description: if the specified function is off, so is this function

ShortInteger.name: desired permutation
ShortInteger.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

ShortInteger.description: if non-zero, will try to use model permutations with names that end in that number, e.g. 7 would pick "body-7" and "head-7"

TagReference.name: animation graph
TagReference.description: leave this blank to use the unit's normal animation graph

Bit.name: stop if death
Bit.description: this conversation will be aborted if any participant dies

Bit.name: stop if damaged
Bit.description: an actor will abort this conversation if they are damaged

Bit.name: stop if visible enemy
Bit.description: an actor will abort this conversation if they see an enemy

Bit.name: stop if alerted to enemy
Bit.description: an actor will abort this conversation if they suspect an enemy

Bit.name: player must be visible
Bit.description: this conversation cannot take place unless the participants can _see_ a nearby player

Bit.name: stop other actions
Bit.description: participants stop doing whatever they were doing in order to perform this conversation

Bit.name: keep trying to play
Bit.description: if this conversation fails initially, it will keep testing to see when it can play

Bit.name: player must be looking
Bit.description: this conversation will not start until the player is looking at one of the participants

Real.name: trigger distance
Real.description: distance the player must enter before the conversation can trigger

Real.name: run-to-player dist
Real.description: if the 'involves player' flag is set, when triggered the conversation's participant(s) will run to within this distance of the player

ShortBlockIndex.name: use this object
ShortBlockIndex.description: if a unit with this name exists, we try to pick them to start the conversation

ShortBlockIndex.name: set new name
ShortBlockIndex.description: once we pick a unit, we name it this

Bit.name: wait after until told to advance

ShortBlockIndex.name: addressee participant
ShortBlockIndex.description: this field is only used if the addressee type is 'participant'

TagReference.name: inside cluster sound
TagReference.description: play this only when the player is inside the cluster

Bit.name: use adjacent cluster as portal scale
use adjacent cluster as exterior scale

Explanation.name: dynamic spawn
Explanation.description: non-zero values here overload what appears in multiplayer_globals

Explanation.name: static spawn zones
Explanation.description: lower and upper height can be left at zero, in which case they use the defaults. leaving relevant teams empty means all teams, leaving all games empty means all games

Explanation.name: static spawn zones
Explanation.description: lower and upper height can be left at zero, in which case they use the defaults. leaving relevant teams empty means all teams, leaving all games empty means all games

Explanation.name: WARNING
Explanation.description: Editing fog palette data will not behave as expected with split scenarios

Real.name: spread distance
Real.description: how far fog spreads into adjacent clusters - 0 defaults to 1

RealFraction.name: maximum density
RealFraction.description: fog density is clamped to this value

Real.name: start distance
Real.description: before this distance there is no fog

Real.name: opaque distance
Real.description: the fog becomes opaque (maximum density) at this distance from the viewer

RealFraction.name: maximum density_1
RealFraction.description: fog density is clamped to this value

Real.name: start distance_1
Real.description: before this distance there is no fog

Real.name: opaque distance_1
Real.description: the fog becomes opaque (maximum density) at this distance from the viewer

Explanation.name: PLANAR FOG OVERRIDE
Explanation.description: Planar fog, if present, is interpolated towards these values.

Real.name: planar min distance bias
Real.description: don't ask

Real.name: ecology margin
Real.description: distance from ecology boundary that creature begins to be repulsed

Real.name: weight
Real.description: probability of producing at this source

Real.name: production frequency
Real.description: How frequently boids are produced at one of the sources (limited by the max boid count)

Explanation.name: Flock parameters
Explanation.description: Recommended initial values (for a sentinel-sized unit): neighborhood radius= 6.0 avoidance radius= 3 forward scale= 0.5 alignment scale= 0.5 avoidance scale= 1.0 leveling force scale= 0.1 perception angle= 120 average throttle= 0.75 maximum throttle= 1.0 position scale= 1.0 position min radius= 3 position max radius = 9

Explanation.name: Let me give you a piece of free advice.
Explanation.description: Flocks with a neighborhood radius of 0 don't FLOCK, per se (in the creature-creature interaction kind of way), but they are much cheaper. The best thing is to have a non-zero radius for small flocks, and a zero radius for large flocks (or for 'flow-flocks', ones with sources and sinks that are intended to create a steady flow of something). Note also that for flocks with a 0 neighborhood radius, the parameters for avoidance, alignment, position and perception angle are ignored entirely.

Real.name: neighborhood radius
Real.description: distance within which one boid is affected by another

Real.name: avoidance radius
Real.description: distance that a boid tries to maintain from another

Real.name: forward scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to fly straight ahead

Real.name: alignment scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to align itself with neighboring boids

Real.name: avoidance scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to avoid collisions with other boids, when within the avoidance radius

Real.name: leveling force scale
Real.description: weight given to boids desire to fly level

Real.name: sink scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to fly towards its sinks

Angle.name: perception angle
Angle.description: angle-from-forward within which one boid can perceive and react to another

Real.name: average throttle
Real.description: throttle at which boids will naturally fly

Real.name: maximum throttle
Real.description: maximum throttle applicable

Real.name: position scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to be near flock center

Real.name: position min radius
Real.description: distance to flock center beyond which an attracting force is applied

Real.name: position max radius
Real.description: distance to flock center at which the maximum attracting force is applied

Real.name: movement weight threshold
Real.description: The threshold of accumulated weight over which movement occurs

Real.name: danger radius
Real.description: distance within which boids will avoid a dangerous object (e.g. the player)

Real.name: danger scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's desire to avoid danger

Explanation.name: Perlin noise parameters
Explanation.description: Recommended initial values: random offset scale= 0.2 offset period bounds= 1, 3

Real.name: random offset scale
Real.description: weight given to boid's random heading offset
